summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 12919, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Tenth Avenue West and Eleventh Avenue West, each from Howe Street to Galer Street, and Galer Street, Blaine Street, Garfield Street and Howe Street, each from Tenth Avenue West to Eleventh Avenue West, by grading and regrading the same, and by constructing wooden curbs and gutters, in accordance with Resolution No. 548 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said City, approved December 6, 1899.
